p:
Isotopic data in C processes show great potential to constrain these processes
11, 28, 29 . Indeed, 14C soil profiles have been used to constrain transfer coefficients and turnover rates at multiple sites
28, 30 ; isotopic labeling to trace C pathways is another powerful tool to provide additional constraints to relevant processes, such as distinguishing root respiration from total soil respiration
31 , sources of input
32 , or proportion of different soil C pools
33 . Other additional data, such as soil respiration
34 and soil C incubation datasets
35, 36 are equally valuable constraints. We therefore advocate using isotopic data and other datasets as complementary sources to better constrain model parameters and hence projections.
